newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Alcoa pulls out of Brazil CVRD consortium.
newsitem.headline: Alcoa pulls out of Brazil CVRD consortium.

text.p: Brazil's Alcoa Aluminio SA, a subsidiary of U.S. aluminum company Aluminum Co of America, has pulled out of the Valepar consortium participating in the privatization auction of state mining giant CVRD, the company president said.

Fausto Pena Moreira Junior said Alcoa had decided to withdraw from the Valepar consortium, led by Brazilian steelmaker CSN, because there were no guarantees it could take over CVRD's aluminum operations after privatization.
"Our big interest always was CVRD's aluminum," Moreira Junior said. "We prefer to save the money and buy CVRD's aluminum business after the auction if the new owners decide to sell it."
He said the consortium leadership did not want to decide prior to the auction whether it would sell or keep different branches of CVRD's business.
Alcoa Aluminio is 60-percent-owned by Alcoa of the United States and 40 percent by Brazilian construction company Camargo Correia.
CSN declined to comment on the matter.

Apart from CSN, the other remaining members of Valepar include, Brazilian paper and pulp firm Cia Suzano ; NationsBank Corp ; four Brazilian pension funds, Previ, Petros, Funcef, Funcesp; and Opportunity Asset Management, an offshore investment fund.

Brazil's largest retail bank Bradesco, which is barred from participating in any consortium bidding for CVRD because it was one of the consultants on the selloff, will act as a financing agent to one or more of Valepar's members.
NationsBank will act as a financing agent for CSN's stake in the consortium with $1.2 billion as well as being a full member of the consortium.
South African mining firm Gencor Ltd might still join the consortium as one of four or five companies that have been registered for the auction in case they decide to join in the last minute.

The second consortium competing in the April 29 auction of a 40-45-percent voting stake in CVRD is being led by Brazilian metal, cement and pulp group Votorantim in conjunction with South Africa's Anglo American Corp of South Africa Ltd .
